subject: Re: Where to test?
msgSnippet: Hi, Kent! Your example with Chart API is good. However, your example with payment processing is completely nightmare for me. I didn t understand what does the
messageBody:
Hi, Kent!
Your example with Chart API is good. However, your example with
payment processing is completely nightmare for me. I didn't understand
what does the application, what client thought and what what problem
you strike with. I also didn't understand your Stability and
Reliability aspect. I guess this is because I didn't understand your
payment processing example.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "kentb" <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> All,
>
> Last week on succeeding days I encountered two situations, one where
> system-level tests were valuable and unit tests would have been
useless and
> one where the reverse was true. Since simply the level of the tests
is not
> sufficient to decide where to test, I thought a bit more about how I
should
> decide where to test. I came to three criteria:
> * The cost of writing and running the test
> * The stability of the interface the test is, errr..., testing
> * The reliability of the code satisfying the test
>
> I wrote this up in a little paper:
> www.threeriversinstitute.org/WhereToTest.html. Comments welcome.
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>
